newsitem.title: HUNGARY: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - JUNE 3.
newsitem.headline: HUNGARY NOON RADIO HEADLINES - JUNE 3.

text.p: These are the main headlines on Hungary's Kossuth Radio midday news. Reuters cannot vouch for their accuracy:
- The opposition parties continue to refuse the draft pension reform law.
- The Hungarian army is prepared for joining the NATO, said George A. Joulwan, chief commander of NATO forces in Europe.
- Pope John Paul will receive seven European presidents, including Hungary's Arpad Goncz, for an audience in Poland today.
- The strike of Austrian public employees did not block the traffic at border crossings.
